1960s.title: FIFA Affiliation
1960s.description: Uganda Football Association (UFA) affiliates to FIFA, enabling international play.

1960s.title: AFCON Debut
1960s.description: Uganda qualifies for its first Africa Cup of Nations after independence.

1960s.title: First National League
1960s.description: Uganda launches its first official national football league.

1970s.title: AFCON Runners-up
1970s.description: Uganda reaches the final of AFCON 1978, finishing 2nd after losing to Ghana.

1970s.title: Local Tournament Inauguration
1970s.description: The inaugural local tournament brings the community together.

1990s.title: League Expansion
1990s.description: The national league expands to include more teams, boosting competition.

2010s.title: AFCON Return
2010s.description: Uganda returns to the Africa Cup of Nations after 39 years.

2010s.title: New Stadium Inauguration
2010s.description: The country inaugurates a state-of-the-art stadium to boost local football.

2020s.title: U17 World Cup Qualification
2020s.description: Uganda U17 team qualifies for FIFA U17 World Cup for the first time.

2020s.title: The Digital Revolution in Ugandan Sports Administration
